main_definition: Scanners are devices used to convert physical documents or objects into digital format by capturing their images, text, or data.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the context of computer technology, scanners refer to optical character recognition (OCR) equipment that converts printed texts into editable and searchable digital formats.
meanings_and_examples.example: When I needed to digitize my collection of old newspapers, I used a flatbed scanner with OCR capabilities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the healthcare industry, medical scanners are imaging devices that capture visual representations of internal body structures for diagnostic purposes.
meanings_and_examples.example: The radiologist reviewed the CT scans to diagnose the patient's condition accurately.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In logistics and supply chain management, barcode or RFID (Radio-Frequency Identification) scanners are devices used for capturing data from labels attached to products during inventory control processes.
meanings_and_examples.example: The warehouse workers used handheld scanners to quickly track the movement of goods in and out of storage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In security, metal detectors are a type of scanner designed to identify metallic objects on individuals for safety purposes.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before entering the airport terminal, passengers had their shoes scanned with a metal detector.
